body.p: To his Excellency B. Magoffin Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, We the undersigned citizens would respectfully state ^that^ philip Lee and William Wilson entered as the security of one Thomas Flinn in a bail bond for two hundred & fifty dollars for his appearance in the Bullitt circuit court on a charge for killing the facts were that the man killed had struck Flinn with a sling shot, and then Flinn in self defence killed him. Flinn went away & it is reported that he is dead. Flinn was an Irishman an itinerant worker & so was the man that was killed; none of the commonwealth witnesses attended when the recognisance was forfeited.

We respectfully ask you to remit the fine forfeiture of the recognisance on the part of Lee & Wilson
as we think it just & proper, & clearly within those ^that^ class of cases in which Executive clemency ought to interpose

L Hoglan
